# Air Conditioning Replacement at Joyceville Institution 
## Solicitation Number: 21450-24-4606921

The Correctional Service of Canada intends to replace two outdated R22 air conditioning units at Joyceville Institution with two new, environmentally friendly units.

## Trade Agreement: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

This procurement is open to all interested suppliers and bidding procedures will follow a competitive, non-set-aside strategy. The lowest priced compliant bid will be selected.

### Services Required:
The successful bidder will be required to remove and dispose of the existing R22 refrigerant, compressors, condensers, evaporators, and control lines. They will also be responsible for installing and commissioning two new air conditioning units, model Trane #TTA 180BW00BA, with a capacity of 7.5 T.

### Deliverables:
- Removal of existing R22 refrigerant and disposal in accordance with environmental regulations
- Removal of compressors, condensers, evaporators, supply, return and control lines from existing units
- Disposal of existing units in accordance with environmental regulations
- Supplying, installing, and commissioning new compressors, evaporators, coil sections, condensers, supply, return, and control lines
- Providing replacement units of the same quality and size as the existing units

### Timeframe:
- Construction Time: The contractor must complete the work within 12 weeks from the date of notification of acceptance of the offer.

### Contact Information:
- Contracting Authority: Robin Riha
- Telephone: (613) 328-9727
- Email: [robin.riha@csc-scc.gc.ca](mailto:robin.riha@csc-scc.gc.ca)

### Procurement Documents:
The complete solicitation document and associated documents can be downloaded from the Canada buys/Tenders website. Documents may be submitted in either English or French. After contract award, bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process.

### Notes:
The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Procurement Assistance Canada (PAC) offers seminars to businesses interested in learning how to sell goods and services to the Government of Canada. The seminars are free and can be found on the Buyandsell.gc.ca website.
